Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n>```<n><n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input and response<n>Below is a data set named sales.csv, with one or more data items that show sales and cost for a company in its first year.<n><n>---<n><n><img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Excel-icons.png/200px-Excel-icons.png" alt=""><n><n>| **Item** | **Unit Price** | **Sales** | **Cost** |<n>| --- | --- | --- | ---|<n>| Lunchbox, 8 oz | $3 | 12,160 |$15,248|<n>| 6 inch Lunchbox, 500 pack | $7.2 | 8,428 |$5.9 |<n><n>---<n><n>Below are two tables. Select the response that correctly describes the second table in relation to the first. Your response should not read "A table may be a subset of or may be a superset of another table.".<n><n><img src='http://www.acmicpc.net/static/img/instructions/input.png' alt='Input' width='200px'><n><img src='https://www.acmicpect.net/static/image/instructions/response.png' alt='Response' width='208px'><n><n>### Instructions:Choose the correct response.<n><n>### Response Options:<n><n>### Response 1:Yes, they are subsets.<n><n>### The first table, Sales, has 2 rows and 5 columns with data. Sales lists one type of item and its sales for year, one type of item with its cost. The second table, Production, has 3 rows and 5 columns. Production has one type, a pack size, and two numbers, the amount sold and the cost. Since the second table has the same number (5) of columns as the first, they are subsets of each other. Since the first table has two types of items, Sales is not a subset of Production, which has only one type of item. As you can see, the table Production is not a subset of Sales.<n><n>### Since the table Sales has

Choices:  A: street B: soccer field C: soccer game D: central park E: pool table<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: A <n><n>Answer: 1<n><n>Input: B <n><n>Answer: (3 / 4)<n><n>Input: C <n><n>Answer:<n><n>Input: D <n><n>Answer: *No Comment*<n><n>```python<n>a= str(input())<n>b= str(input()) <n>k= int(input()) <n><n>print('In a pool table, the table'*2*'a'+' the board'*2*'b'+' and the balls'*2*'c'+'the pool area'*2*'d'+' and the table'*2+'e' +'\n\n\n')<n>```<n>

Store the values to variables so that you can access the data later.<n><n>**Instructions: ** <n>- When prompted for their name, they should type in their name.<n>- You should assign the key with input to the variable called `userName`.<n>- When prompted to type their age, they should type in with two numbers.<n>- You should use the value they gave you and assign their age to the variable called `usersAge`.<n><n>**Code**<n><n>```<n>import java.util.*;<n>import java.lang.*;<n><n>/*<n> * Name the class that defines your program. Name the class with Upper Camel Case.<n> */<n>public class Assignment_205b_Intro_to_Java_A_PairsBot {<n><n>  /*<n>   * name the class that represents your variables after the class name with lower case letters.<n>   */<n><n>  public static void main(String[] args) {<n><n>    Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);<n><n>    System.out.print("Please input your name: ");<n>    String userName = scan.next();<n><n>    System.exit(0);<n>    System.out<n>       .print("Please input your age: ");<n>    int usersAge = scan.nextInt();<n>  }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instructors Response:<n><n>Aaron<n>: This solution demonstrates how to assign values to variables.<n>However, it does not provide the expected output or behavior

So we should rule C out.<n>- We shouldn't need anything, we just want things. Choices:  A: public place B: roadblock C: space shuttle D: hoverboard E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		<n>**B**<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>### Rationale:The space shuttle uses a high and wide booster to carry it into space. After it's in space, the two solid rocket boosters separate. The space shuttle can travel in space by accelerating and decelerating along its orbit. After performing some maneuvers in space, the space shuttle heads back to Earth. A re-entry path depends on where in orbit it is and where it wants to land it. Space shuttles may return to Earth via the landing strip at their launch sites or via a different runway. After the shuttle reaches Earth's atmosphere, its descent is controlled by two separate systems: the atmospheric-entry control system, which slows the shuttle's re-entry by providing aerodynamic drag control during descent; and the landing gear, which supports the craft as it goes.<n><n>### Input"Choose A if you want to explore the public place."<n><n>### Input "Choose B if you want to explore space."<n><n>### Response"Please do not click B again. It is already chosen."<n><n>### Output"Space!"<n><n>### Instructions<n>Ask the computer program to enter the following information: the height of its booster, the width of its booster, how many rocks it takes to make a carton, the dimensions of its carton, and the dimensions of its packing box.<n><n>### Response "What is your favorite color: A-blue, B-white, C-red, D-green, E-Gold, F-Purple, G-Pink, H-Black, I-Silver, J-Lilac, K-Teal?<n><n>### Response<n>"Choice A, I like the color blue."<n><n>### Reveal<n><n>### Reasons:A<n><n>### Input:"How much do you weigh?"<n><n>### Input<n>"600 lb."<n><n>### Instruct:Ask the computer program the number of rockets that can hold 600 lb.<n><n>### Output:"0.5 rockets"<n><n>### Input.<n>"Five and a half."<n><n>### Questions:In your mind, can you remember what color the program is?<n>

How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a bass clarinet to take home? Choices:  A: orchestra B: school band C: music store D: opera house E: home<n><n>### Response:		Choices A or D<n><n>### Explanation:This question is ambiguous. What does the word "take" mean? Some people think that the word "take" means "get a new one", but other people think that the word means "rent."<n><n>### Input2:Which of the following does the number 84 represent? Choices:  C: the 15th prime number B: the 94th prime number A: the 18th prime number D: the 79th prime number E: the 89th prime number<n><n>### Response2:Choices A or E<n><n>### Explantation2:A common error is picking a number between 50 and 65, which is neither 15th nor 18th prime.<n><n>### Input3:When filling out a survey, a participant can earn a gift with value X by answering any of the questions.  If more than one question is answered right, only one will be selected at random and that person's gift is the one chosen.  If no question is answered right, then the person does not get to claim their prize.  What is the probability that a participant does not get to claim a gift?<n><n>### Response3:Choices A or B<n><n>### Explantation3:There is a 3/12 chance, or 25% of a chance.<n>

If John is about 56 years old, what is the approximate weight in stone blocks of each person?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input:<n>John drinks the first 2 bottles in ounces.<n>John drinks every 15 mph in gallons.<n>John does 10 runs every hour for 8hrs.<n>4 bottles = 250 ounces.<n>4*15 = 60 hours.<n>4*250/25= 6 hour.<n><n><n>### Response to Demo: 141 in ounces = 18 stone blocks.<n><n>### Input<n>I am looking for input on how to handle this problem. Which of the following choices shows that the author of the letter used the informal style of writing? A: spelling some words wrong B: using a friendly tone with the listener C: using formal or advanced vocabulary<n><n>## Solution: <n>A) A, B) B, C) B

Write your answer in the blank.<n><n>### Questions and Answers:<n><n>#### Question:Which of these is a benefit of using an interquartile range, instead of the median, to describe a distribution.<n><n>#### Answer:Answer: It tells you how many data are above the center-half and below the center-half.<n><n>1. It provides a lower bound for the range of a distribution. This bound is typically the range for a distribution, but an interquartile value should not exceed the range.<n>2. Interquartile range is used to describe the dispersion/spread of data around the median.<n>3. Interquartile distribution is used to show the differences between a particular value and the median.<n><n>#### Question:A student's test results are as follows: 80, 75, 87, 94, 92, 85, 73, 85, and 83, which number would a line of best fit through this data likely pass through?<n><n>#### Answer: Answer: 83<n><n>1. Because a line of best fit is based on the idea that if the data "looks like" a straight line, then that line has the best fit with the data.<n>2. The line of best fit will pass through the point having more data compared with all the other points. In the provided data set, this value is 83 and it has the highest number of data.<n><n>#### Questions:Which of the following is/are true?<n><n>#### Answer 1: Answer: The least possible value of n is 4.<n><n>1. The maximum length of a triangle is 1.<n>2. The maximum number of times a function can be differentiated is 0.<n>3. The median of 65 data points is 63.<n><n>#### Answer 2: Answer: All of the above.<n><n>1. True because the least possible value of n can be 4.<n>2. True because the maximum number of times a square root function can be differentiated (or evaluated) is 1.<n>3. True because the median of 65 numbers will yield an average of 63.2.<n><n>#### Question 3: If X is a continuous random

What would be the final amount in ounces?<n><n>### Solution<n>### Answer:The following data is provided to help determine the answer.<n>**Ingredients**:<n>Garlic, chopped fresh = 0.471<n>Basil, chopped fresh =1.429<n>Pounds/32 oz = 0.029<n><n>### Summary:Calculate by using the following data:<n>**Ingredient**:<n>Chopped, fresh basil = 2 cups<n>Chopped, fresh garlic =1 cup<n>Canned tomatoes (1 pint - 16 fl oz) = 32 oz<n>Mayo (1/2 cup) = 8 oz Mayo contains olive oil (which is liquid)<n>Pecans (1 cup) = 7.35 oz<n><n>### Note:<n>**1.** Multiply ounces by their respective value to add totals up.<n>**2.** Subtract the final sum.<n><n>### Steps:<n>**1)** 1.47 oz * 2 cups = 2.94 oz<n>**2)** 0.39 oz +

How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:The shore was now a tourist attraction with nearby little shops, but at one time this what was home to a bustling fishing industry? Choices:  A: seaside town B: resort C: ocean D: california E: beach<n><n>### Response:		<n>**A**<n><n>### Input2: How many times did the boy fall during his bike ride? Choices: 1: no times 2: 5 times 3: 12 times 4: 8 times 5: 10 times<n><n>### Response2:**1**<n><n>### Solution:<n>The answer is **1** because you will find no time in the text. The other choices are times that the boy fell during his ride.<n>

The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:What does a chicken do in a joke? Choices:  A: grill B: go to market C: bring home fish D: eat hamburger E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		<n>Dear Elijah,<n>I want to know how many cups of liquid 5 people drank yesterday.<n>It is easy to calculate. If each person drank 9.25 cups (2 pints), then there are 45 cups.<n><n>### Input - Two-way multiple choice question<n><n>**Input 1:** A: It rained a lot on the way to the party yesterday.   B: A lot of people came to the party yesterday.    <n>**Input 2:** A: We had a party yesterday.   B<n>: We had a lot of guests yesterday.    <n><n>### Resultant number of guests: 80, since it rained and the party was a lot<n><n>Answer: Dear Elijah, I want to know the number of cups of coffee that two people drank yesterday. It is easy to calculate. Let's start with Person A. He should drink 4 cups. Let's see how many did he. How many pints did he drink yesterday?<n>4 / 2 = 2<n>Now he has 2 pints and he drinks both pints, so he gets 4 cups. Next person B should drink 6 cups.<n>20 / 2 = 10<n>Now B has 10 pints and he drink them, so he gets 12 cups. Now we know how many cups A drank. He drank 4 cups. And B drank 12 cups, so how many cups did the two boys drink?<n>12 + 4 = 16 cups<n><n>### Input- Two choices, two ways<n><n>### Solution - use 2 variables to remember each question and then simply add them together to get the answer.<n><n><n>### Input<n>**A:** Tom lives by the coast.   B: Tom likes to grill.<n><n><n>**A:** Doris works at the chocolate factory.   B: Doris likes making brownies.<n><n><n>## Instructions:What are the tasks. How many seconds does the truck travel the remaining distance?<n><n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: A boxer is throwing punches at an opponent. What is the rate of change in the boxer's speed of travel from when he starts throwing punches until when he stops throwing punches?<n><n>Answer: (3 / 10) meters per second per second<n><n>Input: A car rental shop takes 3 minutes to rent a car and 2 hours to return a car. What is the average wait time in minutes for each of these events combined?<n><n>Answer: Average wait time is (3 + 2) / 5 = 2.2<n><n>Input: Alice is planning a dinner for 10 people, all at her own house. She has 10 plates. It takes 3.5 minutes to cut up the vegetables, spread the food on the plates, and serve each person. There are two sets of cutlery, and six plates get split between them, so each plate gets 3 cutlery. In addition to serving people their food, she waits four minutes between each course, one more minute for dessert. After the last course finishes, she cleans for another 20 minutes, then takes 30 minutes to wash the plates. Alice wants 3 minutes to eat her own food, leaving

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:What would you put in a container? Choices:  A: food B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: closet garage E: port<n><n>### Response:		Choosing B, <n>What do cargo ships transport?<n><n>Answers:<n>D:\Docs<n><n><n><n><n><n>

How much do you need in income if the house changes to a small house?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input:The cost of a small house is 60% of the cost of a large house.<n>Output: 150<n><n>### Comment<n>You need an income equal t 18% of $100,000 to buy a large house and that income is $18,000 You have to use the formula I = i * p to solve for p.<n>18 * 1000<n>p =<n>60% of $18,076  is equal 150 dollars and that is my answer.<n><n>### Input <n>What you need for an income to buy a small house is 18% of,7 dollars? <n>Output:36.9 dollars<n><n>### Demos

The flight has a cruising speed of 489 knots. If there is a headwind of 40 knots and a tailwind of 100 knots what is the ETA of the flight?<n><n>### Answer:  The ETA of the flight is 9:00am<n><n>Their cruising speed is 489 kn, which equals 584 miles.<n>We have 584 miles  - 40 kn of headwind = 544 miles left of the trip.<n>We have 100 kn Tailwind = 584 miles left over from the trip.<n>The cruising speed is 584 miles / 4 hours = 145 miles/hour.<n>The Total time to travel the 145 miles to get back which is just 3 hours left in the trip.<n>This would equal the flight arriving at 9am.<n><n>### InputWhen using any type of tool, its important to use the right sized tool for the job. Choices:  A.  correct B.  important C.  large D.  small<n><n>### Instance:"Give me a hand," said the mother.

Choices:  A: let down B: respect C: illness D: satisfaction E: gratitude<n><n>### Response:		Answer to the response of input A<n><n>### Input A:It was frustrating not being able to go out for a while, after a day of rain, it had the ability to stop my car from starting. In other works I thought I had a flat tyre, what I needed was it to take me to the nearest petrol station before anything else, but at least I managed to get home after about four miles. Choices:  A. go to the petrol station B. check that it is not a flat tyre C. check for fuel D. do some washing up E. go to the gym<n><n>### Response B<n><n>### Input B:Due to a recent change in my routine, I have lost 3 kilos in the last couple of months that I did not have before. I now have to carry three pairs of leather socks to work each day. Choices: 1. start by walking home after work. 2. continue to run each day after finishing. 3. buy a bigger shoes. 4. not buy any leather socks any more. 5 not carry any more leather socks to the workplace. 6 start going to the gym for more exercise Choices: A. start by walking home each day. B. continue to running every day after finishing. C. go to the gysp. D. not buy any more leather sock to work. E. not carry any more lether socks. F. not walk to work. G. stop to go to the gym.<n><n>### Context: The store where Adam went to buy nuts and fruit sells kilograms of it but also sells litres of it too. In order to convert 3 kilograms to litres, you take 3 times the volume of 1 litre of the same fruit. Likewise, if you want to know how much nuts cost, we can do the same thing. For dried fruit you double its price.<n><n>### Input C:Two people went for a jog yesterday, they found their way to the starting line at one minute intervals, the first jogging for two minutes the second for ten minutes, they continued at this rate for as long as they could, until the winner jogged twice around the 1.6 mile course. Choice:1.The first runner jogged 10 miles.

How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:If you're afraid of spiders what should you avoid owning? Choices:  A: meadow B: cupboard C: shed D: mail box E: cellar<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Input<n>```  If you're afraid of dogs what should you avoid owing? Choices: A: cellar B: shed C: cupboard D: meadow E:mail box. ```<n><n>### Response <n>```  Choices: if you're afraid of  dumbst what should you avoid owin? <n>      Choices:  B: shed <n>      A: cellar```<n><n>### Explantion<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Exsplantion<n><n>### Input <n>``` A: The answer is 7.   ```<n><n>### Response  <n>``` 7```<n><n>### Instuctions 2:<n>``` Answer the following multiple choice question to finish this task. <n><n>Input  :  At a grocery store, apples cost $0.50 a pound. Eggs cost $3.25 a dozen. How many eggrolls are sold for $1.95?<n>A:  15<n>B:  16<n>C:  8<n>D:  17<n>E:  25<n>```<n><n>### Multiple  options:<n><n>```  15```<n><n>### Task 5:<n>```  Please finish the following mathematical problem. Then answer the maths questions below. <n>      6 - 3 = <n>             A 7 <n>             B 5 <n>             C 8<n>             D 4<n>             E 6 <n>```<n><n>## Multiple options: <n>```  8```<n><n>## Task5:<n>```  Which of the following multipe options in the above image could be multiplied <n><n>       8 x 5<n>          5 x 4<n>```<n><n>## Answer: 40<n>### Explanaton:<n>```<n>You may start by picking one of the three numbers to the left of the X. <n>If the answer is in the 1-30 range, those are all valid choices. <n>If it is in the 40-59 then only numbers with a 0 in the units place. <n>If it's in the 60 to 99 range, those numbers would need to 100. <n>```<n><n><n>

The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:Where would you carry a pen as you go through your day? Choices:  A: pocket B: office supply store C: friend's house D: desk drawer E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: A<n><n><n>## Warm-up:<n><n>```python<n>def calculate_price(x_kg, x_dollars_per_kg, y_kg, y_dollars_kg, y_total_dollars):<n>    return ((x_kg * y_dollars) + (y_kg * y_kg * x_dollars))<n>    <n>def calc_total_hours(x_hours_gym_week_1, x_hours_week_2, x_week_3):<n>    return x_hours_gymn_week_1 + x_hours_weeks_2 + x_week_3<n><n>def calculate_how_much_money(x_hours, y_x_dollars): <n>    return ((x * 200) + (y * y))<n><n>def calculate_fluid_consumed(x_cans_soda, x_cups_water):<n>    return ((12 * x_cans_sodas) + (8 * x_cups_soda))<n><n>def calculate(total_number_blocks, number_of_blocks, number, number_of_people, number_of_boxes):<n>    return total_number_blocks * number / number_of_blocksto_people * number / number_boxs<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: smile B: shake hands C: express gratitude D: say you're welcome E: appreciate compliment<n><n>### Response:		If I wanted to... A) I will shake hands to show my appreciation B) I will say your welcome to show my appreciation C) I will tell them it is my pleasure to do good at whatever task D) I will smile to show them that it make me happy to do good<n><n>Output:<n><n>* E: appreciate<n><n>C# Code:<n><n>```cs<n>class Question1<n>{<n>    public static void Main()<n>    {<n>        Dictionary<string.char.ToString(), string> dictionary = new Dictionary<string.char, string><n>        {<n>           { char.A.ToString(), "shake hands" },<n>           { char.B.ToString(), "say you're welcome" },<n>           {  char.C.ToString(), "smile" },<n>           {char.E.ToString(), "express gratititude"},<n><n><n>        };<n><n>        string.Join(", ", dictionary.select(x => x.Key).toList(), ", ");<n><n>        Console.WriteLine(string.Join(",", dictionary.Values.toList(), ", "));<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>JavaScript Code:<n><n>```bash<n>const Question1 = () => {<n>    return  new Map([<n>        ['a','shake hands'],<n>        ['b','say you're welcome'],<n>        ['c','smile'],<n>        ['d', 'express gratitude']<n>    ]);<n>};<n><n>const myString = Question1()<n><n>   .values()<n>   .join('|')<n><n>console.log(myString);<n>```<n><n>Answer: <n>1. A<n>2. B<n>3. C<n>4. D

D. 8 hours each night.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Question：<n>Write a python function that takes a two element list of numbers. The function is guaranteed to use all of them, and the two elements need not be of the same size. The function should print the average.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```Java<n>public static void main(String[] args)<n>{<n>    Scanner inp = new Scanner(System.in);<n>    System.out.println("enter a list of nums");<n>int x=inp.nextInt();<n>int y=inp.nextId();<n>double sum=x+y;<n>double avg=(sum/2.0);<n>System.out.println(avg);<n>}<n>```<n>

Each rectangle is the same length as width and each has sides that are square. What dimensions should the plywood have?<n><n>### [Solution](./image04.png)<n><n>- The rectangles should have length (x) of 1 ft and width (y) of 1 ft. Choices:  A: redemption B: isolation C: absolution D: great relief E: feel better<n><n>### Response:		<n>>A<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>When you have a forgiving attitude towards someone, they receive something really good.<n><n>### Input <n><n>1. If you have 8 cups of coffee every day, how many gallons of coffee do you drink?<n>2. If I am walking 16 miles per hour and I am traveling 6 miles north, what direction am I heading?<n>3. How many pounds does 4 pounds of potatoes weigh?<n>4. I used $87.63 worth of plastic. How much money is left in my account?<n>5. I've eaten 6 strawberries. How many more can I eat before I need to go to the store to buy more strawberries?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Explanatin:  First you need to figure out 1 and 2 first by multiplying the two numbers, then you will have x. To find the direction in which you're heading you need to use atan2<n><n>  ```<n>  var x = 16*6; // 16 miles is 12 times of 1 hour, but 6 miles goes for 30 min<n>  var y = -10; // We are running away from the store<n>  var direction = atan2(y, x);<n>  // direction is around to -8.466828411357865<n>  // Or you can find the inverse trigonometric function and then calculate the direction (this would make more sence)<n>  ```<n><n>So we know that after multiplying the two answers we got, the direction is -8.46<n><n>I got my direction using the second answer so I wouldn't have to do the entire process to find the direction.<n><n><n>

How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. I used ¾ cup of flour and no salt. I also used 3 eggs and 2 ounces of cheese. After being refrigerated for twenty hours, I then baked it at 375 degrees for one hour with the door open the entire time. How long did it take to cook?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>If the flour is the only thing we multiply by its size is 3.5. We have 2 eggs and 1.5 oz. of cheese if we multiply each of those by 3 we get 10 and 5 we get 75. We have an hour at 375 in the oven. Now we have to use addition. We add the 75 to 3 plus two one will get 78. We now subtract from 78 the 36 (since the temperature is decreased by 1) that is 78-36=32. So the answer is roughly 23 minutes. But if we look back at the oven temperature, we can see that the oven temperature cannot be 78, since the degree sign is only a fraction. So the temperature must be 378 degrees F.<n><n>### Exercise:<n><n>Input: My coworker has a pet cat. The cat is 3 pounds heavier than my cat. My cat is 18 pounds. My coworker's cat is 70 pounds. How much heavier is the cat than my coworker's pet cat?<n><n># Part 1:<n>### Response:D<n>### Explanartion:<n>Clarifies the process in which the answer is figured out.<n>The coworker has a cat that weighs 70 pounds, and my cat weighs 120. If my coworker has a 3 pound cat and mine weights 18, this would mean that 3x70=210, 18x210=3840, 70x210=.29x3840=.10x35840=.29x8880=.30x143340=.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:How often are secular parties held? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		The secular party is rarely held and is unpredictable.  It's usually a 9,9 or 4,3 party.<n>

A<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the questions below.<n><n>### The number of goals scored by exactly two players last year accounts for <n>20% of all the goals scored by these two players. What if they scored a total of 10 goals between them. <n><n>The total amount of goals scored in the particular league last year was 162. How many goals did that 162 goals include if each team scored (in total) 15 goals?<n>Answer:<n><n>- The total number of goals scored by both players was 10<n>- Each player scored 5 goals<n>We just need to find out how many goals 5 represents in total. <n><n>5/162 =.03125 or 1/32<n><n>Each player got 1/32 goals out of the total.<n><n>- 10/162 = 0.06042 or 1/16<n><n>Each team scored 1/16 of the total goals, so that means each player scored 1/15 of the total goals = 0.73333 or 6/8.<n>

Try not to use any of the given answers when doing so.<n><n>#### Input:This city is located in the middle of a Northern Norway that is filled with things to do like Arctic fox and Polar Nights half-marathons.<n><n>#### Response:Tromsø, Norway is a small city that is the capital of the Troms region. In the winter, the city experiences Polar Nights, but in the summer, the sun rises. There are many other things to do in Tromsø such as taking a ski lift to the top of a mountain and watching the stars at night.<n><n>#### Input.The northern most area in Norway is found in this city.<n><n>#### Response.Tromsø is the northernmost city in Norway.<n><n>#### Instruction: Answer the following question.Use the clues from the text to determine the correct answer.<n><n>>What is the northernmost city?<n><n>#### Response: The northernmost city in Norway is Tromsø.<n><n>#### Instructions.Answer the given question<n><n>>What is another place to find polar lights in the world in the middle of the city?<n><n>##### Response<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. How did he distribute the apples?<n>Choices:  (C) Give one to boy and one to the girl (D) Give one to boy (A) Give one to girl.<n><n>### Response (D)<n><n>### Input : A man has three apples and two children. One is smaller than the other. He gives the smallest child one apple to the older one. But the older one is not satisfied. He wants the man to give a second apple. What will the man do such that both children will be satisfied?<n>Choices: (B) Give the other apple to the smaller child (A) Give an apple to both children.<n><n>### Answer (B)<n><n>### Example: An airplane flies $1.8\text{hours}$ from New York.<n>Choices: (D) $\sqrt 6\text{hours or }1.5\text{hours}+1.5\text hour$ (C) $\sqrt 6$ or $1.5\text hours\pm1$ (E) Any one of the above.<n><n>### Example Answer:  D. $1.5\pm 1\text{ hours}$<n><n>Answer C is incorrect because at least the plus or the minus should be multiplied by the quantity and thus the amount of change in hours will always be $1.5\times\pm 1$.<n><n>Answer D is wrong because there is no square

The x-coordinate of the graph of this function is equal to -1/3, which is not greater than or equal to zero.<n><n>### Response<n><n>1. 2X^(X-1) for positive values.<n>2. (2X^(X-2))^(2)<n>3. You can add any number of terms, such as (2X^(X1))^(2)+(3X^(X2))^(2)+(10X^(X4))<n><n>### Input and Response:<n>The correct choice is A, as iceboxes are typically kept in the kitchen.<n><n>### Expected Response from Tutor:<n>A<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>"It's A; they are held in chicken coops."<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>If you need additional explanation of the task, see below:<n><n>Write a program that allows the user to enter numbers in three categories: drinking, eating, and sleeping, to obtain their BMI. Your program should ask for their age, then prompt the user to enter three values, a maximum of one per minute. The user should then be prompted again to enter three more values. When they finish entering all of the relevant values, the program should compute their BMI and then state whether it falls in the normal, underweight, overweight, or obese range.<n><n>### What If?<n><n>If a user enters more or less than three values, print an appropriate error message. For example, if they enter less than three values print "You need to enter at least three values for your body mass index!"; if they enter more than three values, print "Too many values! Only three allowed!"; if one of the values is missing, print "The value you entered is missing from the required fields."<n><n>The function is required is myfunction.<n><n>The three categories of the drinking, eating and sleeping will be named as a list of drinking, eating or sleeping.<n><n>The calculation is:<n><n>  BMI = ( weight in kg * 453 ) / height in m^2<n><n><n>### Example Outside Score:<n><n>You receive 4 points for achieving the requirement, and an additional 4 points for the functionality of the program.   <n><n>### Example Inside Score:<n><n>If you receive all 4 points after completing the requirement and successfully achieving the functionality.   <n><n>The following are examples of how to achieve the requirement for calculating BMI.<n><n>  var BMI = Math.round(functionBMI(age, drinking_weight, drinking_height, eating_weight, eating_height, sleep_weight, sleep_height, functionBMI));<n>  var msg = "Your BMI is: " + BMI.;<n>  console.log(msg);<n><n>Or<n><n>  var fdrinking_weight = 234;<n>  var fdrinkin_height = 65;<n>  var fsleeping_weight= 200

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:The explorers found a central passage, much to their delight it led straight to the ancient buried what? Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n><n>### Response:		The ancient buried treasure<n><n>If you had questions about this code, we recommend posting an issue here on this repository.<n><n>### Submission:<n><n>Add a function to your `index.js` file called `$multiChoice`. This function should take two arguments. The first one is an input, which, according to the instruction, contains the instruction and the amount of times the question will be asked followed by each question. The second one is an array of answers.<n><n>You should provide an empty response on the first call for the user to confirm, and then provide the responses for each call to the question.<n><n>The question itself should be presented to the user with the `printf` function. The correct answer should be provided with the `println` function to the users.<n><n>All the data should be stored within an array called `question`.<n><n>```javascript<n>const questions = [{<n>  question: ['How much did his purchases at a store cost?',<n>    ['Adam bought 3 kilogols of nuts and 3 kilograms dried fruits at the store.',<n>    'Adam bought exactly 3 kilograms.'],<n>    56],<n>  <n>  },<n>  <n>  {<n>  question: ['Every day, Tom drinks 5 twelve ounces cans of soda and 72 ounces of water per day. How many ounches of fluids is he drinking a week?',<n>    ['Tom wants to drink 4 cans of soda a day.',<n>    'Tom wants to drink a quart of soda a day'],<n>    868],<n><n>  },<n>...<n>]<n>```<n><n>### `multiChoice.js`<n>```javascript<n>const multiChoice = (question, answers) => {<n>  console.log('\n');<n>  while (question.length) {<n>    const input = question.shift()<n>    console.log(input)<n><n>    const answer = answers.find(answers => answers[0] === input[0])<n>    console.log('Choice:', answer[0])<n><n>    if (answer[0] === input.join(' ')) {<n>      console.log("Thanks!")<n>    } else {<n>      console.error("Wrong")<n>    }<n>  }<n>}<n>```<n>

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Input:The person turned the oven on and put a pizza in, what happened one hour later? Choices:  A: pet shops B: new mexico C: white house D: arctic E: garden of eden<n><n>### Response:		The snake would likely want to live in the Garden of Eden, as this is very sunny. If the snake prefers pet shops, it would go to either New Mexico or the White House. The snake should not be going to the Arctic, since that's not sunny there.  If this snake prefers warm weather, it definitely wouldn't want to go to the White House or the Arctic.<n><n>### Input :  How many days does it take for water to travel to and from the surface of the earth and back?<n>Choice  :  0.00631 24.4 3  0.0041 18.8 4  years 200  years  58,440.5 years 10 years <n><n>### Response : The correct answer is (4). Water takes between 58,44 years to get to the surface and be reused, or 24.4 days to run all the way to space and the back. As to why water's travel time has increased is unknown.<n><n>### Comments : 40 hours is the minimum you have to work in a week to make 1$ an hour. Average lifespan in the U.S is approximately 77.6 years.
